channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: America's immigration crackdown is disrupting the global remittance market
item.description: America's immigration crackdown might have serious financial consequences for a range of countries.

item.title: As Trump talks of designating antifa a foreign terrorist group, experts see danger
item.description: The designation would have, as one domestic terrorism expert told NPR, a "cascading effect across civil society, including social media organizations,...

item.title: Louisiana officials waited months to warn public of whooping cough outbreak
item.description: After a whooping cough outbreak killed two infants, Louisiana health officials waited months to officially alert physicians or do public outreach. Tha...

item.title: SNAP benefits set to expire this week. And, Jamaica braces for a Category 5 storm
item.description: Over 40 million Americans will soon be without federal food assistance as SNAP benefits are set to expire on Saturday. And, Jamaica braces for Hurrica...

item.title: Volunteers foster literacy by reading to children and giving them books
item.description: Volunteers with the LiTEArary society read to children who live in "book deserts" and bring them their own books.

item.title: US kills 14 in strikes on four alleged drug boats in Pacific
item.description: It is the latest in a series of attacks on boats the US says have been carrying drugs in both the Pacific and Caribbean.

item.title: A federal agent’s daring plan: Recruit Maduro’s pilot to turn on the Venezuelan leader
item.description: A federal agent had a daring plan: persuade Nicolas Maduro’s chief pilot to surreptitiously divert the Venezuelan president’s plane to a place where U...

item.title: Pregnant British teenager's family pay £137,000 to reduce sentence in Georgia jail
item.description: The pregnant 19-year-old faces drugs charges in Georgia and is back in court on Monday.

item.title: Amazon confirms 14,000 job losses in corporate division
item.description: The company says the opportunities provided by AI means it needs to be "organised more leanly."

item.title: Israel says coffin from Hamas did not contain another hostage's body
item.description: Israel accuses Hamas of a "clear violation" of the ceasefire deal after tests showed the remains belonged to a person whose body was previously return...

item.title: Food banks are preparing for a surge as federal food aid could be paused in the government shutdown
Israel says Hamas violates peace deal by returning partial hostage remains

item.title: Trump signs U.S.-Japan trade deal before planned China talks
item.description: President Trump signed trade and military agreements with Japan on the first leg of his Asia tour and touted the importance of the U.S. alliance. CBS ...

item.title: 10/28: CBS Morning News
item.description: Jamaica braces for Hurricane Melissa landfall; 13-year-old girl plays quarterback for school's team.

item.title: With food stamps set to dry up, SNAP recipients say they fear what's next
item.description: "Now we'll have to prioritize which bills we can pay and which can wait," said one mother of two about a looming freeze in food aid.

item.title: PayPal signs deal with OpenAI to embed payment system into ChatGPT
item.description: PayPal announced​ Tuesday that it will embed its digital payment wallet into ChatGPT.

item.title: Tourist plane crash in Kenya kills 11 on board
item.description: The aircraft was flying from a popular coastal resort to a game park when it came down.

item.title: Chicago’s children are getting caught in the chaos of immigration crackdowns
